introduction: This video provides an introduction to object-oriented programming in Python. It covers the concept of objects, their data representation, and the methods that can be used to interact with them. The video demonstrates how to define custom classes and methods, as well as the use of the distance method to calculate the distance between two coordinate objects.

sections.title: Section 1: Introduction to Objects
content: Explanation of objects and their data representation in Python
Example of a coordinate object and its methods

sections.title: Section 2: Defining Custom Classes
content: Explanation of classes and their purpose
Defining a custom class for a coordinate object
Initializing and accessing the x and y coordinates

sections.title: Section 3: Distance Method and Fraction Objects
content: Explanation of the distance method and its use
Converting the result to a fraction object
Example of using the distance method and fraction objects

sections.title: Section 4: Layering Abstractions with Objects
content: Explanation of object layers and their purpose
Example of building layers with integer, float, list, dictionary, and custom objects
Advanced topics such as inheritance and polymorphism

sections.title: Section 5: Recap and Practice
content: Summary of key concepts and topics covered in the video
